sense.name: wound, gash made by cutting flesh
sense.examples: The doctor asked the woman whether the slash on her wrist was intentional. John got a nasty slash on his foot when he stepped on a broken beer bottle.

sense.name: cleared tract of land in a forest, cut or burned
sense.examples: We viewed the ugly slash caused by a recent forest fire. New seedlings are being planted in several clear-cut slashes.

sense.name: punctuation mark that functions as a separator
sense.examples: John put a slash between the 'and' and the 'or'. I use slashes between numbers in a calendar date, instead of dashes.

sense.name: a sweeping cut with a sharp instrument
sense.examples: We could see the slash of the scythes as the men harvested the wheat. The killer's slash of the victim in the shower is the film's most famous scene. Their slash through the jungle was only possible with machetes.

sense.name: an ornamental slit in a garment
sense.examples: The slashes on the jacket just below the waist are decorative.

sense.name: a bright patch of color
sense.examples: Slashes of golden sunlight fell between the bars of the window. The room was decorated in creamy white with an occasional slash of deep blue.
